title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: A novel set in the American South during the 1930s, dealing with serious issues of rape and racial inequality.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian regime and its effects on society.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: A story of teenage angst and alienation in American society.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A romantic novel set in rural England, focusing on the dynamics of class, marriage, and relationships.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A novel depicting the decadence of the Jazz Age and the American Dream.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: A fantasy novel about the journey of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, to win a share of the treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
summary: A novel about the obsessive quest of Captain Ahab for revenge against the white whale that destroyed his ship and severed his leg.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: The first book in the Harry Potter series, following the magical journey of a young wizard.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: An epic high-fantasy novel about the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
summary: A dystopian novel depicting a future society where humans are genetically engineered and socially conditioned for compliance.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
summary: A psychological novel that explores morality, guilt, and redemption through the experiences of Rodion Raskolnikov, an impoverished ex-student in St. Petersburg.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
summary: A post-apocalyptic novel about a father and son's journey across a desolate landscape.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
summary: A novel set in the Yorkshire moors, depicting the passionate and destructive love between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
summary: A novel chronicling the Buendía family through several generations in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
summary: A philosophical novel about the consequences of vanity and hedonism.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
summary: A novel depicting the adventures of a young boy and a runaway slave as they journey down the Mississippi River.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
summary: A novel exploring the themes of love, infidelity, and societal norms in 19th-century Russia.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
summary: A novel about the struggles and triumphs of a young orphan girl, Jane Eyre, in 19th-century England.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
summary: A novel about a poor family of tenant farmers driven from their Oklahoma home by drought, economic hardship, and changes in financial and agricultural industries.

title: Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
summary: A satirical novel set during World War II, focusing on the absurdities of war and bureaucracy.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
summary: A science fiction-infused anti-war novel about the bombing of Dresden in World War II.

title: Gone with the Wind
author: Margaret Mitchell
summary: A novel set in the American South during the Civil War and Reconstruction era, focusing on the life of Scarlett O'Hara.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
summary: A novel narrated by Death about a young girl in Nazi Germany who steals books and shares them with her neighbors and the Jewish man hidden in her basement.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
summary: A historical novel set in early 19th-century France, depicting the struggles of ex-convict Jean Valjean and his experience of redemption.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
summary: A novel about the consequences of adultery and shame in Puritan New England.

title: The Outsiders
author: S.E. Hinton
summary: A novel about the rivalry between two groups of teenagers, the Greasers and the Socs, in a small American town.

title: A Clockwork Orange
author: Anthony Burgess
summary: A dystopian novel about juvenile delinquency and the government's attempt to control behavior through psychological conditioning.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
summary: A novel about a scientist who creates a grotesque creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
summary: A novel exploring complex themes such as faith, reason, and morality through the lives of three brothers.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
summary: A novel about a man who is falsely imprisoned and seeks revenge against those who betrayed him.

title: Middlemarch
author: George Eliot
summary: A novel that explores the lives and relationships of the inhabitants of a fictional English town.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
summary: A dystopian novel set in a future totalitarian society where women are subjugated.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
summary: An epic novel set during the Napoleonic Wars, depicting Russian society in the early 19th century.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
summary: A satirical novel about an elderly man who believes he is a knight and sets out on adventures with his loyal squire, Sancho Panza.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
summary: A novel about a detached and amoral Algerian man who faces the absurdity of human existence.

title: The Stand
author: Stephen King
summary: A post-apocalyptic horror novel depicting the aftermath of a deadly plague.

title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
summary: A collection of detective stories featuring Sherlock Holmes and his loyal friend, Dr. Watson.

title: The Little Prince
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
summary: A novella about a young prince who travels from planet to planet, meeting various inhabitants and learning about love, loss, and loneliness.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
summary: A bildungsroman novel tracing the growth and personal development of an orphan named Pip.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
summary: A novel about a young shepherd named Santiago who dreams of finding a treasure in Egypt and learns important life lessons along the way.

title: Heart of Darkness
author: Joseph Conrad
summary: A novella exploring the darkness of the human psyche through the journey of Charles Marlow into the African Congo.

title: The Master and Margarita
author: Mikhail Bulgakov
summary: A novel blending supernatural elements with political satire, focusing on Satan's visit to Soviet Moscow and its impact on its inhabitants.

title: The Bell Jar
author: Sylvia Plath
summary: A semi-autobiographical novel about a young woman's descent into mental illness.

title: East of Eden
author: John Steinbeck
summary: A novel about two families, the Trasks and the Hamiltons, and their intertwined destinies in the Salinas Valley.

title: Norwegian Wood
author: Haruki Murakami
summary: A novel exploring themes of loss, love, and mental health among college students in 1960s Tokyo.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
summary: A horror novel about a family that becomes haunted while wintering in a deserted hotel.

title: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway
summary: A novel depicting the lives of expatriates in the aftermath of World War I, focusing on the Lost Generation.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
summary: A novel about the friendship between two boys in Afghanistan and the tragic events that separate them.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
summary: A mystery thriller novel following journalist Mikael Blomkvist and hacker Lisbeth Salander as they investigate a decades-old disappearance.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
summary: A science fiction novel about an astronaut stranded on Mars and his struggle to survive.
